pull.title: net: update signet seeds
pull.body:
I had to reinstall the server that hosts my DNS seed (see #11962) and Signet seed node. This replaces the IPv6 address and also adds an IPv4 address (identical to `seed1.testnet.bitcoin.sprovoost.nl`).

Alternatively and/or additionally I could spin up a DNS seed for Signet, which only requires a hostname, to avoid future IP address change pull requests.

net: update signet seeds

events.body:
Congrats on PR 23000 !

> Alternatively and/or additionally I could spin up a DNS seed for Signet, which only requires a hostname, to avoid future IP address change pull requests.

I was thinking about this as well, can't we add a DNS resolve in between, it's not like it happens very often, but it seems inconvenient to have to update all software everytime there's a server move or such.

issue.title: net: switch to signet DNS seed
issue.body:
I spun up a DNS seed for Signet, source: https://github.com/sipa/bitcoin-seeder/pull/94

If anyone else spins up a DNS seed, let me know in the comment and I'll add it.

Because one DNS seed is not very diverse, this PR leaves two hardcoded nodes just in case (). The one dropped node no longer exists.

Replaces #23000.

events.body: I wrote an alternative PR #23021 that introduces a DNS seed. Though if for some reason that takes a long time to merge, this PR could go first. Otherwise feel free to close.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#23021](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23021) (net: switch to signet DNS seed by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
